summary: This is an email exchange regarding the unsealing of documents in the Epstein case, sent from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Vyskocil's chambers on October 16, 2020. It includes the forwarding of a signed unsealing order and procedural instructions for handling the document.

persons.name: Mary Kay Vyskocil
persons.context: The Honorable Judge Vyskocil is the recipient of the email and the signatory of the attached unsealing order.

persons.name: Daniel M. Vitagliano
persons.context: Daniel M. Vitagliano is the law clerk to Judge Vyskocil who sends the signed unsealing order back to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: Chris is the recipient of the email from Daniel Vitagliano forwarding the signed unsealing order.

connections.description: Daniel M. Vitagliano is identified as the law clerk to Judge Mary Kay Vyskocil.

events.title: Unsealing Order Signed
events.description: Judge Mary Kay Vyskocil signs an unsealing order related to the Epstein case, which is then forwarded by her law clerk to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: An unsealing order in the Epstein case was signed by Judge Mary Kay Vyskocil on October 16, 2020.
The order was processed through email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Judge Vyskocil's chambers.
The document indicates procedural handling for sensitive legal materials, noting it would be placed in a 'red sealing envelope.'
